title: Array2DExtensions.rebase

rebase 
Builds a new array whose elements are the same as the input array but
 where a non-zero-based input array generates a corresponding zero-based
 output array.

title: Array2DExtensions.map
content:
Array2DExtensions.map 
map 
Builds a new array whose elements are the results of applying the given function
 to each of the elements of the array. 
For non-zero-based arrays the basing on an input array will be propogated to the output
 array.

title: Array2DExtensions.mapi
content:
Array2DExtensions.mapi 
mapi 
Builds a new array whose elements are the results of applying the given function
 to each of the elements of the array. The integer indices passed to the
 function indicates the element being transformed. 
For non-zero-based arrays the basing on an input array will be propagated to the output
 array.

title: ArrayExtensions.allPairs

ArrayExtensions.allPairs 
allPairs 
Returns a new array that contains all pairings of elements from the first and second arrays.

insertAt 
Return a new array with a new item inserted before the given index.

title: ArrayExtensions.insertManyAt
content:
ArrayExtensions.insertManyAt 
insertManyAt 
Return a new array with new items inserted before the given index.

title: ArrayExtensions.removeAt
content:
ArrayExtensions.removeAt 
removeAt 
Return a new array with the item at a given index removed.

title: ArrayExtensions.removeManyAt

ArrayExtensions.removeManyAt 
removeManyAt

title: ArrayExtensions.splitAt
content:
ArrayExtensions.splitAt 
splitAt 
Splits an array into two arrays, at the given index.

title: ArrayExtensions.tryExactlyOne
content: ArrayExtensions.tryExactlyOne tryExactlyOne Returns the only element of the array or None if it is empty or contains more than one element.

title: ArrayExtensions.updateAt
content:
ArrayExtensions.updateAt 
updateAt 
Return a new array with the item at a given index set to the new value.

title: ArrayExtensions.append
content:
ArrayExtensions.append 
append 
Builds a new array that contains the elements of the first array followed by the elements of the second array.

title: ArrayExtensions.collect
content:
ArrayExtensions.collect 
collect 
For each element of the array, applies the given function. Concatenates all the results and return the combined array.

title: ArrayExtensions.copy
content:
ArrayExtensions.copy 
copy 
Builds a new array that contains the elements of the given array.

title: ArrayExtensions.tryPick
content: ArrayExtensions.tryPick tryPick Applies the given function to successive elements, returning the first result where function returns Some(x) for some x. If the function never returns Some(x) then None is returned.

title: ArrayExtensions.pick
content: ArrayExtensions.pick pick Applies the given function to successive elements, returning the first result where function returns Some(x) for some x. If the function never returns Some(x) then KeyNotFoundException is raised.

title: ArrayExtensions.choose
content:
ArrayExtensions.choose 
choose 
Applies the given function to each element of the array. Returns
 the array comprised of the results "x" for each element where
 the function returns Some(x)

title: ArrayExtensions.countBy
content:
ArrayExtensions.countBy 
countBy 
Applies a key-generating function to each element of an array and returns an array yielding unique
 keys and their number of occurrences in the original array.

title: ArrayExtensions.distinctBy
content:
ArrayExtensions.distinctBy 
distinctBy 
Returns an array that contains no duplicate entries according to the
 generic hash and equality comparisons on the keys returned by the given key-generating function.
 If an element occurs multiple times in the array then the later occurrences are discarded.

title: ArrayExtensions.groupBy
content:
ArrayExtensions.groupBy 
groupBy 
Applies a key-generating function to each element of an array and yields an array of
 unique keys. Each unique key contains an array of all elements that match
 to this key.

title: ArrayExtensions.pairwise
content:
ArrayExtensions.pairwise 
pairwise 
Returns an array of each element in the input array and its predecessor, with the
 exception of the first element which is only returned as the predecessor of the second element.

title: ArrayExtensions.skip
content:
ArrayExtensions.skip 
skip 
Builds a new array that contains the elements of the given array, excluding the first N elements.

title: ArrayExtensions.skipWhile
content: ArrayExtensions.skipWhile skipWhile Bypasses elements in an array while the given predicate returns true, and then returns the remaining elements in a new array.

title: ArrayExtensions.take
content: ArrayExtensions.take take Returns the first N elements of the array. Throws InvalidOperationException if the count exceeds the number of elements in the array. Array.truncate returns as many items as the array contains instead of throwing an exception.

title: ArrayExtensions.takeWhile
content: ArrayExtensions.takeWhile takeWhile Returns an array that contains all elements of the original array while the given predicate returns true, and then returns no further elements.

title: ArrayExtensions.truncate
content:
ArrayExtensions.truncate 
truncate 
Returns at most N elements in a new array.

title: ArrayExtensions.where
content:
ArrayExtensions.where 
where 
Returns a new array containing only the elements of the array
 for which the given predicate returns "true".

title: ArrayExtensions.windowed
content:
ArrayExtensions.windowed 
windowed 
Returns an array of sliding windows containing elements drawn from the input
 array. Each window is returned as a fresh array.

title: ArrayExtensions.indexed
content:
ArrayExtensions.indexed 
indexed 
Builds a new array whose elements are the corresponding elements of the input array
 paired with the integer index (from 0) of each element.

title: ArrayExtensions.exists
content:
ArrayExtensions.exists 
exists 
Tests if any element of the array satisfies the given predicate. 
The predicate is applied to the elements of the input array. If any application
 returns true then the overall result is true and no further elements are tested.
 Otherwise, false is returned.

title: ArrayExtensions.filter
content:
ArrayExtensions.filter 
filter 
Returns a new collection containing only the elements of the collection
 for which the given predicate returns "true".

title: ArrayExtensions.find
content: ArrayExtensions.find find Returns the first element for which the given function returns 'true'. Raise KeyNotFoundException if no such element exists.

title: ArrayExtensions.findIndex
content: ArrayExtensions.findIndex findIndex Returns the index of the first element in the array that satisfies the given predicate. Raise KeyNotFoundException if none of the elements satisy the predicate.

title: ArrayExtensions.forall
content:
ArrayExtensions.forall 
forall 
Tests if all elements of the array satisfy the given predicate. 
The predicate is applied to the elements of the input collection. If any application
 returns false then the overall result is false and no further elements are tested.
 Otherwise, true is returned.

title: ArrayExtensions.fold
content: ArrayExtensions.fold fold Applies a function to each element of the collection, threading an accumulator argument through the computation. If the input function is f and the elements are i0...iN then computes f (... (f s i0)...) iN

title: ArrayExtensions.foldBack
content: ArrayExtensions.foldBack foldBack Applies a function to each element of the array, threading an accumulator argument through the computation. If the input function is f and the elements are i0...iN then computes f i0 (...(f iN s))

title: ArrayExtensions.IsEmpty
content:
ArrayExtensions.IsEmpty 
IsEmpty 
Returns true if the given array is empty, otherwise false.

title: ArrayExtensions.IsEmpty
content:
ArrayExtensions.IsEmpty 
IsEmpty 
Returns true if the given array is empty, otherwise false.

title: ArrayExtensions.iter
content:
ArrayExtensions.iter 
iter 
Applies the given function to each element of the array.

title: ArrayExtensions.iteri
content:
ArrayExtensions.iteri 
iteri 
Applies the given function to each element of the array. The integer passed to the
 function indicates the index of element.

title: ArrayExtensions.length
content:
ArrayExtensions.length 
length 
Returns the length of an array. You can also use property array.Length.

title: ArrayExtensions.length
content:
ArrayExtensions.length 
length 
Returns the length of an array. You can also use property array.Length.

title: ArrayExtensions.map
content:
ArrayExtensions.map 
map 
Builds a new array whose elements are the results of applying the given function
 to each of the elements of the array.

title: ArrayExtensions.mapi
content:
ArrayExtensions.mapi 
mapi 
Builds a new array whose elements are the results of applying the given function
 to each of the elements of the array. The integer index passed to the
 function indicates the index of element being transformed.

title: ArrayExtensions.partition
content:
ArrayExtensions.partition 
partition 
Splits the collection into two collections, containing the
 elements for which the given predicate returns "true" and "false"
 respectively.

title: ArrayExtensions.permute
content:
ArrayExtensions.permute 
permute 
Returns an array with all elements permuted according to the
 specified permutation.

title: ArrayExtensions.reduce
content: ArrayExtensions.reduce reduce Applies a function to each element of the array, threading an accumulator argument through the computation. If the input function is f and the elements are i0...iN then computes f (... (f i0 i1)...) iN. Raises ArgumentException if the array has size zero.

title: ArrayExtensions.reduceBack
content: ArrayExtensions.reduceBack reduceBack Applies a function to each element of the array, threading an accumulator argument through the computation. If the input function is f and the elements are i0...iN then computes f i0 (...(f iN-1 iN)). Raises ArgumentException if the array has size zero.

title: ArrayExtensions.reverse
content:
ArrayExtensions.reverse 
reverse 
Returns a new array with the elements in reverse order.

title: ArrayExtensions.scan
content: ArrayExtensions.scan scan Like fold, but return the intermediary and final results.

title: ArrayExtensions.scanBack
content: ArrayExtensions.scanBack scanBack Like foldBack, but return both the intermediary and final results.

title: ArrayExtensions.sortBy
content:
ArrayExtensions.sortBy 
sortBy 
Sorts the elements of an array, using the given projection for the keys and returning a new array.
 Elements are compared using Operators.compare. 
This is not a stable sort, i.e. the original order of equal elements is not necessarily preserved.
 For a stable sort, consider using Seq.sort.

title: ArrayExtensions.sortWith
content:
ArrayExtensions.sortWith 
sortWith 
Sorts the elements of an array, using the given comparison function as the order, returning a new array. 
This is not a stable sort, i.e. the original order of equal elements is not necessarily preserved.
 For a stable sort, consider using Seq.sort.

title: ArrayExtensions.sortInPlaceBy
content:
ArrayExtensions.sortInPlaceBy 
sortInPlaceBy 
Sorts the elements of an array by mutating the array in-place, using the given projection for the keys.
 Elements are compared using Operators.compare. 
This is not a stable sort, i.e. the original order of equal elements is not necessarily preserved.
 For a stable sort, consider using Seq.sort.

title: ArrayExtensions.sortInPlaceWith
content:
ArrayExtensions.sortInPlaceWith 
sortInPlaceWith 
Sorts the elements of an array by mutating the array in-place, using the given comparison function as the order.

title: ArrayExtensions.toList
content:
ArrayExtensions.toList 
toList 
Builds a list from the given array.

title: ArrayExtensions.toSeq
content:
ArrayExtensions.toSeq 
toSeq 
Views the given array as a sequence.

title: ArrayExtensions.tryFind
content: ArrayExtensions.tryFind tryFind Returns the first element for which the given function returns true. Return None if no such element exists.

title: ArrayExtensions.tryFindIndex
content:
ArrayExtensions.tryFindIndex 
tryFindIndex 
Returns the index of the first element in the array
 that satisfies the given predicate.

title: ArrayExtensions.zip
content: ArrayExtensions.zip zip Combines the two arrays into an array of pairs. The two arrays must have equal lengths, otherwise an ArgumentException is raised.

title: ArrayExtensions.zip3
content: ArrayExtensions.zip3 zip3 Combines three arrays into an list of pairs. The three arrays must have equal lengths, otherwise an ArgumentException is raised.

title: ArrayExtensions.exactlyOne
content:
ArrayExtensions.exactlyOne 
exactlyOne 
Returns the only element of the array.

title: ArrayExtensions.sortByDescending
content:
ArrayExtensions.sortByDescending 
sortByDescending 
Sorts the elements of an array, in descending order, using the given projection for the keys and returning a new array.
 Elements are compared using Operators.compare. 
This is not a stable sort, i.e. the original order of equal elements is not necessarily preserved.
 For a stable sort, consider using Seq.sort.

title: ArrayExtensions.tryFindIndexBack
content:
ArrayExtensions.tryFindIndexBack 
tryFindIndexBack 
Returns the index of the last element in the array
 that satisfies the given predicate.

title: ArrayExtensions.tryFindBack
content: ArrayExtensions.tryFindBack tryFindBack Returns the last element for which the given function returns true. Return None if no such element exists.

title: ArrayExtensions.tryItem
content: ArrayExtensions.tryItem tryItem Tries to find the nth element in the array. Returns None if index is negative or the input array does not contain enough elements.

title: ArrayExtensions.tail
content:
ArrayExtensions.tail 
tail 
Returns a new array containing the elements of the original except the first element.

title: ArrayExtensions.head
content:
ArrayExtensions.head 
head 
Returns the first element of the array.

title: ArrayExtensions.last
content:
ArrayExtensions.last 
last 
Returns the last element of the array.

title: ArrayExtensions.tryLast
content: ArrayExtensions.tryLast tryLast Returns the last element of the array. Return None if no such element exists.

title: ArrayExtensions.tryHead
content: ArrayExtensions.tryHead tryHead Returns the first element of the array, or None if the array is empty.

title: ArrayExtensions.transpose
content:
ArrayExtensions.transpose 
transpose 
Returns the transpose of the given sequence of arrays.

title: EventExtensions.merge
content:
EventExtensions.merge 
merge 
Fires the output event when either of the input events fire.

title: EventExtensions.map
content:
EventExtensions.map 
map 
Returns a new event that passes values transformed by the given function.

title: EventExtensions.filter
content:
EventExtensions.filter 
filter 
Returns a new event that listens to the original event and triggers the resulting
 event only when the argument to the event passes the given function.

title: EventExtensions.partition
content:
EventExtensions.partition 
partition 
Returns a new event that listens to the original event and triggers the
 first resulting event if the application of the predicate to the event arguments
 returned true, and the second event if it returned false.

title: EventExtensions.split
content:
EventExtensions.split 
split 
Returns a new event that listens to the original event and triggers the
 first resulting event if the application of the function to the event arguments
 returned a Choice1Of2, and the second event if it returns a Choice2Of2.

title: EventExtensions.choose
content:
EventExtensions.choose 
choose 
Returns a new event which fires on a selection of messages from the original event.
 The selection function takes an original message to an optional new message.

title: EventExtensions.scan
content:
EventExtensions.scan 
scan 
Returns a new event consisting of the results of applying the given accumulating function
 to successive values triggered on the input event.  An item of internal state
 records the current value of the state parameter.  The internal state is not locked during the
 execution of the accumulation function, so care should be taken that the
 input IEvent not triggered by multiple threads simultaneously.

title: EventExtensions.add
content:
EventExtensions.add 
add 
Runs the given function each time the given event is triggered.

title: EventExtensions.pairwise
content:
EventExtensions.pairwise 
pairwise 
Returns a new event that triggers on the second and subsequent triggerings of the input event.
 The Nth triggering of the input event passes the arguments from the N-1th and Nth triggering as
 a pair. The argument passed to the N-1th triggering is held in hidden internal state until the
 Nth triggering occurs.

title: ObservableExtensions.merge
content:
ObservableExtensions.merge 
merge 
Returns an observable for the merged observations from the sources.
 The returned object propagates success and error values arising
 from either source and completes when both the sources have completed. 
For each observer, the registered intermediate observing object is not
 thread safe. That is, observations arising from the sources must not
 be triggered concurrently on different threads.

title: ObservableExtensions.map
content:
ObservableExtensions.map 
map 
Returns an observable which transforms the observations of the source by the
 given function. The transformation function is executed once for each
 subscribed observer. The returned object also propagates error observations
 arising from the source and completes when the source completes.

title: ObservableExtensions.filter
content:
ObservableExtensions.filter 
filter 
Returns an observable which filters the observations of the source
 by the given function. The observable will see only those observations
 for which the predicate returns true. The predicate is executed once for
 each subscribed observer. The returned object also propagates error
 observations arising from the source and completes when the source completes.

title: ObservableExtensions.partition
content:
ObservableExtensions.partition 
partition 
Returns two observables which partition the observations of the source by
 the given function. The first will trigger observations for those values
 for which the predicate returns true. The second will trigger observations
 for those values where the predicate returns false. The predicate is
 executed once for each subscribed observer. Both also propagate all error
 observations arising from the source and each completes when the source
 completes.

title: ObservableExtensions.split
content: ObservableExtensions.split split Returns two observables which split the observations of the source by the given function. The first will trigger observations x for which the splitter returns Choice1Of2 x. The second will trigger observations y for which the splitter returns Choice2Of2 y The splitter is executed once for each subscribed observer. Both also propagate error observations arising from the source and each completes when the source completes.

title: ObservableExtensions.choose
content: ObservableExtensions.choose choose Returns an observable which chooses a projection of observations from the source using the given function. The returned object will trigger observations x for which the splitter returns Some x. The returned object also propagates all errors arising from the source and completes when the source completes.

title: ObservableExtensions.scan
content:
ObservableExtensions.scan 
scan 
Returns an observable which, for each observer, allocates an item of state
 and applies the given accumulating function to successive values arising from
 the input. The returned object will trigger observations for each computed
 state value, excluding the initial value. The returned object propagates
 all errors arising from the source and completes when the source completes. 
For each observer, the registered intermediate observing object is not thread safe.
 That is, observations arising from the source must not be triggered concurrently
 on different threads.

title: ObservableExtensions.add
content:
ObservableExtensions.add 
add 
Creates an observer which permanently subscribes to the given observable and which calls
 the given function for each observation.

title: ObservableExtensions.subscribe

subscribe 
Creates an observer which subscribes to the given observable and which calls
 the given function for each observation.

title: ObservableExtensions.pairwise
content:
ObservableExtensions.pairwise 
pairwise 
Returns a new observable that triggers on the second and subsequent triggerings of the input observable.
 The Nth triggering of the input observable passes the arguments from the N-1th and Nth triggering as
 a pair. The argument passed to the N-1th triggering is held in hidden internal state until the
 Nth triggering occurs. 
For each observer, the registered intermediate observing object is not thread safe.
 That is, observations arising from the source must not be triggered concurrently
 on different threads.

title: SeqExtensions.append

SeqExtensions.append

Wraps the two given enumerations as a single concatenated
 enumeration. 
The returned sequence may be passed between threads safely. However,
 individual IEnumerator values generated from the returned sequence should not be accessed

title: SeqExtensions.cache
content:
SeqExtensions.cache 
cache 
Returns a sequence that corresponds to a cached version of the input sequence.
 This result sequence will have the same elements as the input sequence. The result
 can be enumerated multiple times. The input sequence will be enumerated at most
 once and only as far as is necessary.  Caching a sequence is typically useful when repeatedly
 evaluating items in the original sequence is computationally expensive or if
 iterating the sequence causes side-effects that the user does not want to be
 repeated multiple times.

 Enumeration of the result sequence is thread safe in the sense that multiple independent IEnumerator
 values may be used simultaneously from different threads (accesses to
 the internal lookaside table are thread safe). Each individual IEnumerator
 is not typically thread safe and should not be accessed concurrently. 
Once enumeration of the input sequence has started,
 it's enumerator will be kept live by this object until the enumeration has completed.
 At that point, the enumerator will be disposed.

 The enumerator may be disposed and underlying cache storage released by
 converting the returned sequence object to type IDisposable, and calling the Dispose method
 on this object. The sequence object may then be re-enumerated and a fresh enumerator will
 be used.

content:
SeqExtensions.choose 
choose 
Applies the given function to each element of the list. Return
 the list comprised of the results "x" for each element where
 the function returns Some(x). 
The returned sequence may be passed between threads safely. However,
 individual IEnumerator values generated from the returned sequence should not
 be accessed concurrently.

Remember sequence is lazy, effects are delayed until it is enumerated.

title: SeqExtensions.compareWith
content:
SeqExtensions.compareWith 
compareWith 
Compares two sequences using the given comparison function, element by element.
 Returns the first non-zero result from the comparison function.  If the end of a sequence
 is reached it returns a -1 if the first sequence is shorter and a 1 if the second sequence
 is shorter.

title: SeqExtensions.countBy
content:
SeqExtensions.countBy 
countBy 
Applies a key-generating function to each element of a sequence and returns a sequence yielding unique
 keys and their number of occurrences in the original sequence. 
Note that this function returns a sequence that digests the whole initial sequence as soon as
 that sequence is iterated. As a result this function should not be used with
 large or infinite sequences. The function makes no assumption on the ordering of the original
 sequence.

title: SeqExtensions.distinctBy
content:
SeqExtensions.distinctBy 
distinctBy 
Returns a sequence that contains no duplicate entries according to the
 generic hash and equality comparisons on the keys returned by the given key-generating function.
 If an element occurs multiple times in the sequence then the later occurrences are discarded.

title: SeqExtensions.splitInto
content: SeqExtensions.splitInto splitInto Splits the input sequence into at most count chunks. This function returns a sequence that digests the whole initial sequence as soon as that sequence is iterated. As a result this function should not be used with large or infinite sequences.

Tests if any element of the sequence satisfies the given predicate. 
The predicate is applied to the elements of the input sequence. If any application
 returns true then the overall result is true and no further elements are tested.
 Otherwise, false is returned.

SeqExtensions.filter

 for which the given predicate returns "true". This is a synonym for Seq.where. 
The returned sequence may be passed between threads safely. However,
 individual IEnumerator values generated from the returned sequence should not be accessed concurrently.

 Remember sequence is lazy, effects are delayed until it is enumerated.

The returned sequence may be passed between threads safely. However,

 A synonym for Seq.filter.

SeqExtensions.indexed 
indexed 
Builds a new collection whose elements are the corresponding elements of the input collection
 paired with the integer index (from 0) of each element.

title: SeqExtensions.Item
content:
SeqExtensions.Item 
Item 
Computes the element at the specified index in the collection.

title: SeqExtensions.iter
content:
SeqExtensions.iter 
iter 
Applies the given function to each element of the collection.

title: SeqExtensions.iteri
content:
SeqExtensions.iteri 
iteri 
Applies the given function to each element of the collection. The integer passed to the
 function indicates the index of element.

title: SeqExtensions.length
content:
SeqExtensions.length 
length 
Returns the length of the sequence

title: SeqExtensions.length
content:
SeqExtensions.length 
length 
Returns the length of the sequence

title: SeqExtensions.map
content: SeqExtensions.map map Builds a new collection whose elements are the results of applying the given function to each of the elements of the collection. The given function will be applied as elements are demanded using the MoveNext method on enumerators retrieved from the object. The returned sequence may be passed between threads safely. However, individual IEnumerator values generated from the returned sequence should not be accessed concurrently.

title: SeqExtensions.mapi
content:
SeqExtensions.mapi 
mapi 
Builds a new collection whose elements are the results of applying the given function
 to each of the elements of the collection. The integer index passed to the
 function indicates the index (from 0) of element being transformed.

title: SeqExtensions.pairwise
content:
SeqExtensions.pairwise 
pairwise 
Returns a sequence of each element in the input sequence and its predecessor, with the
 exception of the first element which is only returned as the predecessor of the second element.

title: SeqExtensions.mapFold
content:
SeqExtensions.mapFold 
mapFold 
Combines map and fold. Builds a new collection whose elements are the results of applying the given function
 to each of the elements of the collection. The function is also used to accumulate a final value. 
This function digests the whole initial sequence as soon as it is called. As a result this function should
 not be used with large or infinite sequences.

title: SeqExtensions.mapFoldBack
content:
SeqExtensions.mapFoldBack 
mapFoldBack 
Combines map and foldBack. Builds a new collection whose elements are the results of applying the given function
 to each of the elements of the collection. The function is also used to accumulate a final value. 
This function digests the whole initial sequence as soon as it is called. As a result this function should
 not be used with large or infinite sequences.

title: SeqExtensions.permute
content:
SeqExtensions.permute 
permute 
Returns a sequence with all elements permuted according to the
 specified permutation. 
Note that this function returns a sequence that digests the whole initial sequence as soon as
 that sequence is iterated. As a result this function should not be used with
 large or infinite sequences.

title: SeqExtensions.pick
content: SeqExtensions.pick pick Applies the given function to successive elements, returning the first x where the function returns "Some(x)".

title: SeqExtensions.readonly
content:
SeqExtensions.readonly 
readonly 
Builds a new sequence object that delegates to the given sequence object. This ensures
 the original sequence cannot be rediscovered and mutated by a type cast. For example,
 if given an array the returned sequence will return the elements of the array, but
 you cannot cast the returned sequence object to an array.

title: SeqExtensions.reduce
content:
SeqExtensions.reduce 
reduce 
Applies a function to each element of the sequence, threading an accumulator argument
 through the computation. Begin by applying the function to the first two elements.
 Then feed this result into the function along with the third element and so on.
 Return the final result.

title: SeqExtensions.reduceBack
content: SeqExtensions.reduceBack reduceBack Applies a function to each element of the sequence, starting from the end, threading an accumulator argument through the computation. If the input function is f and the elements are i0...iN then computes f i0 (...(f iN-1 iN)).

title: SeqExtensions.reverse
content:
SeqExtensions.reverse 
reverse 
Returns a new sequence with the elements in reverse order.

title: SeqExtensions.scan
content:
SeqExtensions.scan 
scan 
Like fold, but computes on-demand and returns the sequence of intermediary and final results.

title: SeqExtensions.scanBack
content: SeqExtensions.scanBack scanBack Like foldBack, but returns the sequence of intermediary and final results. This function returns a sequence that digests the whole initial sequence as soon as that sequence is iterated. As a result this function should not be used with large or infinite sequences.

title: SeqExtensions.skip
content:
SeqExtensions.skip 
skip 
Returns a sequence that skips N elements of the underlying sequence and then yields the
 remaining elements of the sequence.

title: SeqExtensions.skipWhile
content: SeqExtensions.skipWhile skipWhile Returns a sequence that, when iterated, skips elements of the underlying sequence while the given predicate returns true, and then yields the remaining elements of the sequence.

title: SeqExtensions.sortWith
content:
SeqExtensions.sortWith 
sortWith 
Yields a sequence ordered using the given comparison function. 
This function returns a sequence that digests the whole initial sequence as soon as
 that sequence is iterated. As a result this function should not be used with
 large or infinite sequences. The function makes no assumption on the ordering of the original
 sequence.

 This is a stable sort, that is the original order of equal elements is preserved.

title: SeqExtensions.sortBy
content: SeqExtensions.sortBy sortBy Applies a key-generating function to each element of a sequence and yield a sequence ordered by keys. The keys are compared using generic comparison as implemented by Operators.compare. This function returns a sequence that digests the whole initial sequence as soon as that sequence is iterated. As a result this function should not be used with large or infinite sequences. The function makes no assumption on the ordering of the original sequence. This is a stable sort, that is the original order of equal elements is preserved.

title: SeqExtensions.sortByDescending
content: SeqExtensions.sortByDescending sortByDescending Applies a key-generating function to each element of a sequence and yield a sequence ordered descending by keys. The keys are compared using generic comparison as implemented by Operators.compare. This function returns a sequence that digests the whole initial sequence as soon as that sequence is iterated. As a result this function should not be used with large or infinite sequences. The function makes no assumption on the ordering of the original sequence. This is a stable sort, that is the original order of equal elements is preserved.

title: SeqExtensions.tail
content:
SeqExtensions.tail 
tail 
Returns a sequence that skips 1 element of the underlying sequence and then yields the
 remaining elements of the sequence.

title: SeqExtensions.take
content: SeqExtensions.take take Returns the first N elements of the sequence. Throws InvalidOperationException if the count exceeds the number of elements in the sequence. Seq.truncate returns as many items as the sequence contains instead of throwing an exception.

title: SeqExtensions.takeWhile
content: SeqExtensions.takeWhile takeWhile Returns a sequence that, when iterated, yields elements of the underlying sequence while the given predicate returns true, and then returns no further elements.

title: SeqExtensions.toArray
content:
SeqExtensions.toArray 
toArray 
Builds an array from the given collection.

title: SeqExtensions.toList
content:
SeqExtensions.toList 
toList 
Builds a list from the given collection.

title: SeqExtensions.tryFind
content: SeqExtensions.tryFind tryFind Returns the first element for which the given function returns true. Return None if no such element exists.

title: SeqExtensions.tryFindBack
content: SeqExtensions.tryFindBack tryFindBack Returns the last element for which the given function returns true. Return None if no such element exists. This function digests the whole initial sequence as soon as it is called. As a result this function should not be used with large or infinite sequences.

title: SeqExtensions.tryFindIndex
content: SeqExtensions.tryFindIndex tryFindIndex Returns the index of the first element in the sequence that satisfies the given predicate. Return None if no such element exists.

title: SeqExtensions.tryItem
content: SeqExtensions.tryItem tryItem Tries to find the nth element in the sequence. Returns None if index is negative or the input sequence does not contain enough elements.

title: SeqExtensions.tryFindIndexBack
content: SeqExtensions.tryFindIndexBack tryFindIndexBack Returns the index of the last element in the sequence that satisfies the given predicate. Return None if no such element exists. This function digests the whole initial sequence as soon as it is called. As a result this function should not be used with large or infinite sequences.

title: SeqExtensions.tryPick
content:
SeqExtensions.tryPick 
tryPick 
Applies the given function to successive elements, returning the first
 result where the function returns "Some(x)".

title: SeqExtensions.truncate
content:
SeqExtensions.truncate 
truncate 
Returns a sequence that when enumerated returns at most N elements.

title: SeqExtensions.windowed
content:
SeqExtensions.windowed 
windowed 
Returns a sequence that yields sliding windows containing elements drawn from the input
 sequence. Each window is returned as a fresh array.

title: SeqExtensions.zip
content:
SeqExtensions.zip 
zip 
Combines the two sequences into a list of pairs. The two sequences need not have equal lengths:
 when one sequence is exhausted any remaining elements in the other
 sequence are ignored.

title: SeqExtensions.zip3
content:
SeqExtensions.zip3 
zip3 
Combines the three sequences into a list of triples. The sequences need not have equal lengths:
 when one sequence is exhausted any remaining elements in the other
 sequences are ignored.

title: SeqExtensions.transpose
content:
SeqExtensions.transpose 
transpose 
Returns the transpose of the given sequence of sequences. 
This function returns a sequence that digests the whole initial sequence as soon as
 that sequence is iterated. As a result this function should not be used with
 large or infinite sequences.

title: SeqExtensionsConstrained.except
content:
SeqExtensionsConstrained.except 
except 
Returns a new sequence with the distinct elements of the second sequence which do not apear in the first sequence,
 using generic hash and equality comparisons to compare values. 
Note that this function returns a sequence that digests the whole of the first input sequence as soon as
 the result sequence is iterated. As a result this function should not be used with
 large or infinite sequences in the first parameter. The function makes no assumption on the ordering of the first input
 sequence.

title: Usage examples
content:
Usage examples
Seq functions
The fluent-style members for all Seq.* operations are shown below. Some additional fluent functions are
available for Array, these are not shown here.
open FSharp.Core.Fluent

module SeqExamples =
    let seq1 = seq { 1 .. 10 }
    let seq2 = seq { 11 .. 20 }

    seq1.append(seq2)
    seq1.averageBy(fun x -> float x)
    seq1.cache()
    seq1.choose(fun x -> if x % 2 = 0 then Some x else None)
    seq1.collect (fun n -> [ n; n + 1 ])
    seq1.countBy(fun x -> x)
    seq1.distinct()
    seq1.distinctBy(fun x -> x)
    seq1.exactlyOne()
    seq1.exists(fun x -> x > 1)
    seq1.filter(fun x -> x > 1)
    seq1.find(fun x -> x > 1)
    seq1.findIndex(fun x -> x > 1)
    seq1.tryFind(fun x -> x > 1)
    seq1.tryFindIndex(fun x -> x > 1)
    seq1.tryPick(fun x -> Some x)
    seq1.fold(3, fun z x -> x + z)
    seq1.forall(fun x -> x > 1)
    seq1.groupBy(fun x -> x)
    seq1.head()

title: index
content:
FSharp.Core.Fluent is a collection of inlined methods allowing fluent access
to all FSharp.Core functions for List, Array, Array2D, Array3D, Seq, Option, String, Event and Observable.
For example, this library adds .map, .filter and many other methods for lists, arrays and sequences:
open FSharp.Core.Fluent

let xs = [ 1 .. 10 ]

xs.map(fun x -> x + 1).filter(fun x -> x > 4).sort()

xs.map(fun x -> x + 1)
  .filter(fun x -> x > 4)
  .sort()

Comparison with non-Fluent style
F# code normally uses curried module functions to access functionality for collections,
composed in pipelines:
xs
|> List.map (fun x -> x + 1)
|> List.filter (fun x -> x > 4)

There are reasons F# uses this style of programming by default:
for example, module functions can compose nicely (e.g. xs |> List.map (List.map f)  ).
However "fluent" access can be convenient, especially in rapid investigative programming
against existing data. For this reason, this option makes fluent notation an option.
In almost all case, xs.OP(arg) is equivalent to the pipelined xs |> Coll.OP arg. So
you can freely interconvert betweeen
xs
|> List.map (fun x -> x + 1)
|> List.filter (fun x -> x > 4)

and
xs.map(fun x -> x + 1)
  .filter(fun x -> x > 4)

You can also use pipeline operations after fluent operations:
xs
  .map(fun x -> x + 1)
  |> List.filter(fun x -> x > 4)
  |> Array.ofList

Or use the generic .pipe method to simulate |>
(4.0).pipe(sqrt)

You can't mix pipelining followed by fluent, and attempting to do so can give obscure errors:
xs
  |> List.map(fun x -> x + 1)
  .filter(fun x -> x > 4)  // ERROR: The field or constructor "filter" is not defined

NOTE: append does the natural thing in fluent form
In the the case of xs.append(ys), the result is "xs then ys" - as expected.
However this is different to xs |> List.append ys, which is actually ys then xs due to the way
pipelining and currying works.
Usage examples
See this documentation for examples of using a wide range of the functions.
Contributing and copyright
The project is hosted on GitHub where you can report issues, fork
the project and submit pull requests.
The library is available under MIT license. For more information see the
License file in the GitHub repository.
